Body: Description: Disabled audio devices are now enabled and cannot be disabled (they immediately are reenabled). Stopping the endpoint protector service on the workstation resolves this issue.
What We've Learned Updated: Possible issue with latest agent.
Next Steps Updated: trying to provide customer with 6.2.1.2004 agent.

Email from customer:

From: Schemp, Jeff S <schemj@cpchem.com>

Sent: Tuesday, May 6, 2025 5:26 PM

To: Flaviu Moldovan <Flaviu.Moldovan@netwrix.com>

Subject: RE: RS: 00443570 - unable to disable audio devices after upgrading to client 6.2.4.2000

 

The tray icon appears for me this morning, however, several others report that it does not.

 

Here’s what I have done on my PC:

 

Installed package from our company portal that uninstalled the newer agent and then installed the older (6.2.1) version. No tray icon present post install.

Reinstalled the package. No tray icon present post install.

Rebooted. Tray icon appeared.

 

I’ve asked the rest of my team to perform the same steps.

 

Are there logs somewhere that I can gather from these other workstations that might be helpful? I will not have access to the workstations during our call.

 

Jeff

Next Steps Updated: Customer had some issues with the tray icon for the 6.2.1.2004 agent. Now the issue seems to be resolved and it is being mass deployed by the customer. Waiting to make sure no other issues occur.
---
trying to provide customer with 6.2.1.2004 agent.
